instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hello

I have orange light on the charger, get 20v at the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> DCIN, i have 1 volt on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> even without the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> on the board, don't see any short on the coils

I replaced the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> since it was blown.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What is the diode mode to ground reading on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Check resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18, 19/20 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Ppbus has no continuity
17/18=3ohm
19/20=4.8ohm
27/28=4.9kohm

Ps: these measures were made without the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> being on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
"27/28=4.9kohm"
Fix the problem; check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.

"Ppbus has no continuity"
I didn't ask that...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
"What is the diode mode to ground reading on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?"
I get 0L reading on my multimeter, sorry I miss read...

I have tested the rails and I don't see disconnects or high ohm.

I see 778ohm across <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and 3.9khom across <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>.

I'm sorry but I'm a noob so please be patient with me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Resistors value marked on the schematic.
Seems that both are bad in this case.

"I get 0L reading on my multimeter"
Learn how to properly use the multimeter in diode mode:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I'm gonna get me the schematic, board viewer it's not enough, will scavenge resistors from the donor, then I will report. 

This is my reading, reverse is the same, it reads something for a second then I get this... 

[ATTACH type="full"]60829[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Be aware of using auto mode on multimeter; select proper scale.
Do not make confusion between ohm and diode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Ok so, diode mode gives me 0.444v with positive on ground, 2.315v with negative on ground...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
These are correct values; doesn't seem to have any problem with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> rail.
Just fix <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Am I reading it right? Both are 0ohm resistors right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I would say 10 ohm, as per schematic.
However, even 0 ohm will work...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Oh yeah I see the 10, sorry

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Perfect, fan spin and picture... God bless you, I learned so much.

Thanks!
